meanings.definition: To promote or appoint (someone) to a higher rank or position, typically in the military.
meanings.sent1: The general breveted the soldier for exceptional bravery in battle.
meanings.sent2: The president breveted the officer to the rank of colonel.
meanings.sent3: The sergeant jokingly breveted the private as the 'best coffee maker in the barracks.'
meanings.sent4: Her hard work breveted her as the leader of the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher breveted the student as the class monitor for the week.

meanings.definition: To grant a brevet rank or appointment to (someone).
meanings.sent1: The commander breveted the pilot for completing a dangerous mission.
meanings.sent2: The king breveted the knight for loyal service to the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The coach breveted the player as the 'most improved' on the team.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication breveted her as the top performer in the company.
meanings.sent5: The judge breveted the lawyer as the lead counsel for the case.

meanings.definition: A commission promoting a military officer to a higher rank without increase of pay.
meanings.sent1: The brevet allowed the lieutenant to take on more responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The army issued a brevet to recognize the captain's leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected brevet made the sergeant's day brighter.
meanings.sent4: The brevet served as a symbol of the officer's dedication to duty.
meanings.sent5: The old brevet document was displayed proudly in the officer's office.
